 32117                                  ; =========================================================================
 32118                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 32119                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 32120                                  ;
 32121                                  ;
 32122                                  ; Assembler usage:
 32123                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 32124                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 32125                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 32126                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 32127                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 32128                                  ;
 32129                                  ;	AL  Function
 32130                                  ;	--  --------
 32131                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 32132                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 32133                                  ;	    begin execution.
 32134                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 32135                                  ;
 32136                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 32137                                  ;
 32138                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32139                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32140                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32141                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32142                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32143                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32144                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32145                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32146                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32147                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32148                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32149                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32150                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32151                                  ;
 32152                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 32153                                  ;
 32154                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32155                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32156                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32157                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32158                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32159                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32160                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32161                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32162                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32163                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32164                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32165                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32166                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32167                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32168                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 32169                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32170                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32171                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 32172                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32173                                  ;
 32174                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 32175                                  ;
 32176                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32177                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 32178                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 32179                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32180                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 32181                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 32182                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32183                                  ;
 32184                                  ; Returns:
 32185                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 32186                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 32187                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 32188                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 32189                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 32190                                  ; =========================================================================
 32191                                  ;
 32192                                  ;   Revision history:
 32193                                  ;
 32194                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 32195                                  ;
 32196                                  ; =========================================================================
 32197

 32224                                  	
 32225                                  _$EXEC:
 32226                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32227                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 32228                                  
 32229                                  EXEC001S:
 32230                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 32231                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 32232                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 32233                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 32234                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 32235                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 32236                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 32237                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 32238                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 32239                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 32240                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 32241                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 32242                                  	;
 32243                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 32244                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 32245                                  
 32246                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32247                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 32248                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 32249                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 32250                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 32251                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 32252                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 32253                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 32254                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 32255                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 32256                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 32257                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 32258                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 32259                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 32260                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 32261                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 32262                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 32263                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 32264                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 32265                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32266                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]

 32268                                  	
 32269                                  	; ==================================================================
 32270                                  	; validate function
 32271                                  	; ==================================================================
 32272                                  		      	
 32273                                  	; M068 - Start
 32274                                  	;
 32275                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 32276                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 32277                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 32278                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 32279                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 32280                                  
 32281                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32282 00005C32 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 32283                                  
 32284                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 32285                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 32286                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 32287                                  
 32288 00005C38 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 32289                                  	;jne	short @f
 32290 00005C3A 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 32291                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 32292 00005C3C 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 32293 00005C3D B9[4C04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 32294 00005C40 51                      	push	cx
 32295                                  ;@@:
 32296                                  Exec_@f:
 32297                                  	; M068 - End
 32298                                  	
 32299                                  	;Enter
 32300                                  
 32301 00005C41 55                      	push	bp
 32302 00005C42 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 32303                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 32304                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 32305                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 32306                                  	; 17/12/2022
 32307                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32308 00005C44 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 32309                                  
 32310                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32311 00005C47 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 32312                                  					; M030
 32313 00005C49 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32314                                  
 32315                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32316                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 32317                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2

 32800                                  ;M029; Begin changes

 32802                                  ;check if the current block is larger than 64K. If so, we do not modify

 33246                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 33247                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 33248                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 33249                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 33250                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 33251                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 33252                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 33253                                  ;call is issued.

 33773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33774                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 33775                                  ;
 33776                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 33777                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 33778                                  ;
 33779                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 33780                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 33781                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.

 33796 00006264 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system

 33798

 34016                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 34017                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 34018                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found

 34022                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 34023                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34024                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 34025                                  ;
 34026                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 34027                                  ;	EXIT	none
 34028                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 34029                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34030                                  
 34031                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34032                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34033                                  
 34034                                  arena_free_process:
 34035                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34036                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34037 000062DF 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 34038                                  arena_free_process_start:
 34039 000062E3 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 34040                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 34041 000062E6 E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 34042                                  
 34043                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 34044                                          ;retc
 34045 000062E9 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34046 000062EB 06                      	PUSH    ES
 34047 000062EC 1F                              POP     DS
 34048                                  	;cmp	[1],bx 
 34049 000062ED 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 34050 000062F1 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 34051                                  	;mov	[1],di
 34052 000062F3 893E0100                        MOV     [ARENA.OWNER],DI	; yes... free him
 34053                                  
 34054                                  arena_free_next:
 34055                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ;'Z'
 34056 000062F7 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34057                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 34058                                          ;retz				; never come back no more
 34059                                  	;JZ	SHORT AFP_RETN  ; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 2.11)
 34060                                  	; 14/05/2019
 34061                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34062 000062FA 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 34063                                          
 34064 000062FC E81300                  	CALL    arena_next              ; next item in ES/AX carry set if trash
 34065 000062FF EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 34066                                  
 34067                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34068                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start
 34069                                  	; 20/05/2019
 34070 00006301 36A1[8C00]              	mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]	; ax = umb_head
 34071 00006305 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh		; Q: is umb_head initialized
 34072 00006308 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 34073                                  	
 34074 0000630A 8CDF                    	mov	di,ds			; di = last arena
 34075 0000630C 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; Q: is last arena above umb_head
 34076 0000630E 7318                    	jae	short ret_label		; Y: we've scanned umbs also. done.
 34077 00006310 EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 34078                                  					; M010 - End

 34084                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 34085                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34086                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 34087                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34088                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 34089                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 34090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34091                                  
 34092                                  arena_next:
 34093 00006312 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 34094 00006314 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 34095 00006318 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 34096                                  
 34097                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 34098                                  ;
 34099                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 34100                                  ;       RETN
 34101                                  
 34102                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 34103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34104                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 34105                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34106                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 34107                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 34108                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 34109                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 34110                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34111                                  
 34112                                  check_signature:        
 34113                                  
 34114 00006319 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 34115                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 34116 0000631B 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 34117                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 34118 0000631F 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34119                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34120 00006321 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 34121                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 34122 00006325 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34123 00006327 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 34124                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 34125                                  AFP_RETN:
 34126                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34127                                  check_signature_ok:
 34128                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 34129 00006328 C3                      	RETN
 34130                                  
 34131                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 34132                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34133                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 34134                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 34135                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 34136                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 34137                                  ;
 34138                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 34139                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34140                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34141                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 34142                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 34143                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 34144                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 34145                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34146                                          
 34147                                  Coalesce:
 34148                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34149 00006329 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34150                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 34151                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 34152 0000632C 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 34153 0000632E E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 34154                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 34155 00006331 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 34156                                  
 34157                                  coalesce_check:
 34158                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 34159 00006333 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 34160                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 34161 00006338 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 34162                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 34163 0000633A 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 34164 0000633F 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 34165                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 34166 00006340 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 34167 00006344 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 34168 00006347 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 34169 00006349 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 34170                                  
 34171                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34172                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 34173                                  
 34174                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 34175                                  
 34176                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34178                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 34179                                  ;
 34180                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 34181                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 34182                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 34183                                  ;
 34184                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 34185                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 34186                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 34187                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 34188                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 34189                                  ;
 34190                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 34191                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 34192                                  ;
 34193                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34194                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34195                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34196                                  ;           INT     21h
 34197                                  ;
 34198                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 34199                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 34200                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 34201                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 34202                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 34203                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 34204                                  ;
 34205                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 34206                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 34207                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 34208                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 34209                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 34210                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 34211                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 34212                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 34213                                  ;	USES	All
 34214                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34215                                  
 34216                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34217                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34218                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 34219                                  ;
 34220                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34221                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34222                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34223                                  ;           INT     21h
 34224                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 34225                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 34226                                  ;
 34227                                  ;   Description:
 34228                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 34229                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 34230                                  ;
 34231                                  ;   Error return:

 34552                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34553                                  
 34554                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34556                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 34557                                  ;
 34558                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 34559                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 34560                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 34561                                  ;
 34562                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 34563                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 34564                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 34565                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 34566                                  ;
 34567                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 34568                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 34569                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 34570                                  ;		code.
 34571                                  ;
 34572                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 34573                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 34574                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 34575                                  ;
 34576                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34577                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34578                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 34579                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 34580                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 34581                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 34582                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 34583                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34584                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34585                                  
 34586                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34587                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34588                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34589                                  ;
 34590                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34591                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 34592                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 34593                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 34594                                  ;           INT     21h
 34595                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 34596                                  ;         size possible
 34597                                  ;   Error return:
 34598                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 34599                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 34600                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 34601                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 34602                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34603                                  
 34604                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 34605                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34606                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 34607 000064A1 E8E4AE                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34608

 34611 000064A9 48                              DEC     AX

 34662                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M016, M068 - Start

 34696                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34697                                  
 34698                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34699                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34700                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 34701                                  ;
 34702                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34703                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34704                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34705                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34706                                  ;           INT     21h
 34707                                  ;
 34708                                  ;	ENTRY	
 34709                                  ;		(al) = 0
 34710                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 34711                                  ;
 34712                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 34713                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 34714                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 34715                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 34716                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 34717                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 34718                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 34719                                  ;
 34720                                  ;		(al) = 2
 34721                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 34722                                  ;
 34723                                  ;		(al) = 3
 34724                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 34725                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 34726                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 34727                                  ;
 34728                                  ;
 34729                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34730                                  ;
 34731                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 34732                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 34733                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 34734                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 34735                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 34736                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 34737                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 34738                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 34739                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 34740                                  ;
 34741                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34742                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 34743                                  ;
 34744                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 34745                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 34746                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 34747                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 34748                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 34749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34750                                  
 34751                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34752                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34753                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34754                                  ;
 34755                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34756                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34757                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34758                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34759                                  ;           INT     21h
 34760                                  ;
 34761                                  ;   Error return:
 34762                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 34763                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34764                                  
 34765                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34766                                  _$ALLOCOPER:
 34767                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34768                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 34779                                  	;;jmp	short AllocGetLink

 34785                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 34929                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34930                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34931                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 34932                                  ;
 34933                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 34934                                  ;
 34935                                  ;
 34936                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 34937                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 34938                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 34939                                  ;		   else
 34940                                  ;			DS = last arena
 34941                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 34942                                  ;
 34943                                  ;		   CY if error
 34944                                  ;
 34945                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 34946                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34947                                  
 34948                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34949                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34950                                  
 34951                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34952                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34953                                  	
 34954                                  GetLastArena:
 34955 00006586 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 34956                                  
 34957 00006587 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 34958 0000658B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 34959 0000658D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 34960                                  
 34961 0000658F 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34962                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34963 00006593 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 34964                                  					
 34965                                  GLA_next:
 34966 00006595 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34967 00006597 E878FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34968                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34969                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34970                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34971 0000659A 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34972                                  
 34973 0000659C 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34974 000065A2 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 34975                                  					;    umb_head
 34976                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 34977                                  
 34978 000065A4 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34979                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34980 000065A8 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 34981                                  GLA_chkumb:
 34982 000065AA 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34983                                  GLA_@f:
 34984 000065AC 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 34985                                  
 34986                                  GLA_done:
 34987                                  					; M061 - Start
 34988 000065AE 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34989 000065B4 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 34990                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 34991                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 34992 000065B6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34993 000065B8 E857FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34994                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34995 000065BB 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34996 000065BD 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34997 000065BF 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 34998                                  					; M061 - End
 34999                                  GLA_ret:
 35000                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 35001                                  	;clc
 35002                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35003                                  	;clc
 35004 000065C1 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 35005 000065C2 C3                      	retn				; M061
 35006                                  
 35007                                  GLA_err:
 35008 000065C3 F9                      	stc				; M061
 35009                                  GLA_err2:
 35010 000065C4 58                      	pop	ax
 35011 000065C5 C3                      	retn

 35036                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 35037                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35038                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 35040                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 35041                                  
 35042                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35043                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 35048                                  
 35049                                  SRVC001S:
 35050                                  
 35051 000065C6 [CA65]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 35052 000065C8 [1C66]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 35053 000065CA 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 35054 000065CB [8466]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 35055 000065CD [1D66]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 35056 000065CF [5366]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 35057 000065D1 [5E66]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 35058 000065D3 [6566]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 35059 000065D5 [6C66]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5
 35060 000065D7 [C566]                  		dw	GET_DOS_DATA	; 6
 35061 000065D9 [E966]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 7
 35062 000065DB [E966]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 8
 35063 000065DD [E966]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 9
 35064 000065DF [F566]                  		dw	_$SetExtendedError  ; 10
 35065                                  
 35066                                  SERVER_DISP_END:  ;  LABEL BYTE
 35067                                  
 35068                                  ;SRVC001E label byte
 35069                                  
 35070                                  SRVC001E:
 35071                                  
 35072                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 35073                                  
 35074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35075                                  ;
 35076                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 35077                                  ;
 35078                                  ; Inputs:
 35079                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 35080                                  ; Function:
 35081                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 35082                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 35083                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 35084                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 35085                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 35086                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 35087                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 35088                                  ;			CX User Index
 35089                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 35090                                  ;			BX = UID
 35091                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 35092                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 35093                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 35094                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 35095                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 35096                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 35097                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 35098                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 35099                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 35100                                  ;
 35101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35102                                  
 35103                                  _$ServerCall:
 35104                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35105                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 35106                                  	; 10/06/2019
 35107                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35108                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 35109                                  
 35110                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35111                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 35112 000065E1 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 35113 000065E3 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 35114 000065E5 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 35115 000065E7 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 35116                                  SET_STUFF:
 35117 000065E9 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point to DPL with DS:SI
 35118                                  	;mov	bx,[si+12h]
 35119 000065EB 8B5C12                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.UID]
 35120                                  
 35121                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35122                                  ;SR;
 35123                                  ; WIN386 updates the USER_ID itself. If WIN386 is present we skip the updating
 35124                                  ; of USER_ID
 35125                                  
 35126 000065EE 36F606[3010]01          	test	byte [SS:IsWin386],1
 35127 000065F4 7505                    	jnz	short skip_win386
 35128                                  
 35129                                  ;hkn; SS override for user_id and proc_id
 35130                                  	; 15/08/2018
 35131 000065F6 36891E[3E03]            	MOV	[SS:USER_ID],BX		; Set UID
 35132                                  
 35133                                  skip_win386:
 35134 000065FB 8B5C14                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.PID]
 35135 000065FE 36891E[3C03]            	MOV	[SS:PROC_ID],BX		; Set process ID
 35136                                  NO_SET_ID:
 35137                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35138 00006603 2EFF36[C865]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 35139 00006608 2EFF36[C665]            	PUSH	word [cS:SERVERTAB]	; push table address
 35140 0000660D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35141 0000660E E887AC                  	call	TableDispatch
 35142                                  
 35143                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35144                                  	;mov 	byte [SS:EXETERR_LOCUS],1
 35145 00006611 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; Extended Error Locus
 35146                                  	;error	error_invalid_function
 35147                                  	;mov	al,1
 35148 00006617 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 35149                                  servercall_error:
 35150 00006619 E971A0                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 35151                                  
 35152                                  SERVERRETURN:
 35153 0000661C C3                      	retn
 35154                                  
 35155                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 35156                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 35157

 35415                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 35416                                  
 35417                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 35418                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35419                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 35420                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 35421                                  ;
 35422                                  ;	NOTE:
 35423                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35424                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35425                                  ;
 35426                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35427                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 35428                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 35429                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35430                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 35431                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 35432                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35433                                  
 35434                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35435                                  
 35436                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 35437                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35438                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35439 00006719 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35440                                  	
 35441                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 35442 0000671E 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 35443                                  
 35444                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 35445 00006723 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 35446 00006728 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 35447                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35448                                  	;mov	al,6
 35449 0000672A B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35450                                  ReturnCarry:
 35451 0000672C F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 35452 0000672D C3                      	retn				; go back
 35453                                  pjfn10: 
 35454                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 35455 0000672E 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 35456 00006733 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 35457                                  	;clc
 35458                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 35459 00006735 C3                      	retn
 35460                                  
 35461                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 35462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35463                                  ;
 35464                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 35465                                  ;
 35466                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 35467                                  ;
 35468                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 35469                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 35470                                  ;                   AX has error code
 35471                                  ;               Carry Reset
 35472                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 35473                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 35474                                  ; NOTE:
 35475                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35476                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35477                                  ;
 35478                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35479                                  
 35480                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35481                                  
 35482                                  SFFromHandle:
 35483 00006736 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 35484                                  	;retc				; return if error
 35485 00006739 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 35486 0000673B 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 35487                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35488                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35489                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35490                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35491                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35492                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35493 0000673F 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 35494                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35495                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35496                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35497                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35498                                  GetSF:
 35499 00006741 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 35500 00006742 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 35501 00006745 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 35502 00006747 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 35503 0000674A 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 35504 0000674B C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 35505                                  
 35506                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 35507                                  
 35508                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 35509                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35510                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 35511                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 35512                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 35513                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 35514                                  ;
 35515                                  ;   NOTE:
 35516                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 35517                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35518                                  ;
 35519                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 35520                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35521                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 35522                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 35523                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 35524                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35525                                  
 35526                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35527                                  
 35528                                  SFFromSFN:
 35529                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35530                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35531 0000674C 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35532                                  
 35533                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 35534 00006751 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 35535                                  sfsfn5:	
 35536                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 35537 00006756 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 35538 0000675A 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 35539                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 35540 0000675C 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 35541 00006760 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 35542                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 35543 00006763 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 35544 00006766 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 35545 00006768 F9                      	STC
 35546 00006769 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 35547                                  sfsfn7:
 35548 0000676A 50                      	push	ax
 35549                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 35550                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35551                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 35552                                  	
 35553                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35554 0000676B B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 35555                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35556                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 35557                                  	
 35558 0000676D F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 35559 0000676F 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 35560 00006771 58                      	pop	ax
 35561                                  	;add	di,6
 35562 00006772 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 35563 00006775 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 35564                                  
 35565                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 35566                                  
 35567                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 35568                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35569                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 35570                                  ;
 35571                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35572                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35573                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 35574                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 35575                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35576                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35577                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 35578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35579                                  
 35580                                  JFNFree:
 35581 00006776 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 35582                                  jfnf1:	
 35583 00006778 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 35584 0000677B 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 35585 0000677D 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 35586 00006781 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 35587 00006783 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 35588 00006784 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 35589                                  
 35590                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 35591                                  jfnf5:	
 35592                                  	;mov	al,4
 35593 00006786 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 35594                                  jfnfx:	
 35595 00006788 C3                      	retn				; bye
 35596                                  
 35597                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 35598                                  
 35599                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 35600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35601                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 35602                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35603                                  ;
 35604                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 35605                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 35606                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 35607                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 35608                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 35609                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 35610                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 35611                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 35612                                  ;
 35613                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 35614                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 35615                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 35616                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 35617                                  ;
 35618                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35619                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 35620                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 35621                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 35622                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35623                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35624                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35625                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 35626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35627                                  
 35628                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 35721                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 35722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35723                                  ;
 35724                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 35725                                  ;
 35726                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 35727                                  ;		path
 35728                                  ;
 35729                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35730                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 35731                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 35732                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 35733                                  ;
 35734                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35735                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 35736                                  ;	USES	all
 35737                                  ;
 35738                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35739                                  
 35740                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35741                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35742                                  
 35743                                  _$CLOSE:
 35744                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 35745                                  
 35746 000067D1 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 35747 000067D4 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 35748 000067D6 16                      	push	ss
 35749 000067D7 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 35750 000067D8 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 35751 000067DC 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 35752                                  
 35753                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 35754                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 35755                                  ;
 35756                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 35757                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 35758                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 35759                                  
 35760                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 35761 000067E0 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 35762 000067E4 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 35763                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 35764 000067E6 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 35765                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 35766 000067EA 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 35767                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 35768 000067EC 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 35769 000067EE 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 35770                                  
 35771                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 35772                                  ; -1.
 35773                                  
 35774                                  FreeJFN:
 35775 000067F0 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 35776 000067F3 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 35777                                  PostFree:
 35778                                  
 35779                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 35780                                  
 35781 000067F7 E89CC7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 35782                                  
 35783                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 35784                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 35785                                  
 35786 000067FA 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 35787                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 35788 000067FC B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 35789                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35790                                  CloseOk:
 35791 000067FE E9839E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 35793 00006801 E9899E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR

 36023                                  ;	BREAK <$READ - Read from a file handle>
 36024                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36025                                  ;
 36026                                  ;**	$Read - Read from a File Handle
 36027                                  ;
 36028                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 36029                                  ;
 36030                                  ;	LDS	DX, buf
 36031                                  ;	MOV	CX, count
 36032                                  ;	MOV	BX, handle
 36033                                  ;	MOV	AH, Read
 36034                                  ;	INT	int_command
 36035                                  ;	  AX has number of bytes read
 36036                                  ;
 36037                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = file handle
 36038                                  ;		(cx) = byte count
 36039                                  ;		(ds:dx) = buffer address
 36040                                  ;	EXIT	Through system call return so that to user:
 36041                                  ;		  'C' clear if OK
 36042                                  ;		    (ax) = bytes read
 36043                                  ;		  'C' set if error
 36044                                  ;		    (ax) = error code
 36045                                  ;

 36048                                  _$READ:

 36053

 36055 000068ED E83E01                  	call	CheckOwner		; get the handle
 36056 000068F0 7303                    	JNC	short ReadSetup		; no errors do the operation
 36057                                  
 36058                                  ;	Have an error. 'C' set
 36059                                  
 36060                                  ReadError:
 36061                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36062                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR		; go to error traps
 36063                                  	;jmp	short CommitErrorj3

 36513                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 36514                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36515                                  ;
 36516                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 36517                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 36518                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 36519                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 36520                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 36521                                  ;   Error returns:
 36522                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 36523                                  ;
 36524                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36525                                  
 36526                                  _$DUP2:
 36527 00006A20 53                      	push	bx
 36528 00006A21 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 36529 00006A22 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 36530 00006A24 E8AAFD                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 36531 00006A27 5B                      	pop	bx
 36532 00006A28 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 36533 00006A29 E8EDFC                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 36534 00006A2C EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup
 36535                                  
 36536                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 36537                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36538                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 36539                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 36540                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 36541                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 36542                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 36543                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 36544                                  ;
 36545                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 36546                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 36547                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 36548                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 36549                                  ;	USES	none
 36550                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36551                                  
 36552                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36553                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
