 36594                                  ;============================================================================
 36595                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36596                                  ;============================================================================
 36597                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 36598                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36599                                  
 36600                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 36601                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 36602                                  
 36603                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 36604                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 36605                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 36606                                  
 36607                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 36608                                  ;
 36609                                  ;	$AssignOper
 36610                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 36611                                  ;	InitCDS
 36612                                  ;	$UserOper
 36613                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 36614                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 36615                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 36616                                  ;
 36617                                  ;   Revision history:
 36618                                  ;
 36619                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 36620                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 36621                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 36622                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 36623                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 36624                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 36625                                  ;				    aliasing.
 36626                                  ;
 36627                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 36628                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 36629                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 36630                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 36631                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 36632                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 36633                                  ;
 36634                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 36635                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 36636                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 36637                                  ;
 36638                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 36639                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 36640                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 36641                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 36642                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 36643                                  ;
 36644                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 36645                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 36646                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 36647                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 36648                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 36649                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 36650                                  ;
 36651                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 36652                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 36653                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 36654                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 36655                                  ;   number.
 36656                                  ;
 36657                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 36658                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 36659                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 36660                                  ;   TransPath.
 36661                                  ;
 36662                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 36663                                  
 36664                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 36665                                  
 36666                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 36667                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 36668                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 36669                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 36670                                  ;					; current drive)
 36671                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 36672                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 36673                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 36674                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 36675                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 36676                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 36677                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 36678                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 36679                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 36680                                  
 36681                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 36682                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36683                                  ; Inputs:
 36684                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 36685                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 36686                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 36687                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 36688                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 36689                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 36690                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 36691                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 36692                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 36693                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 36694                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36695                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 36696                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 36697                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36698                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 36699                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 36700                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 36701                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 36702                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 36703                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 36704                                  ; Function:
 36705                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 36706                                  ; Returns:
 36707                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 36708                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36709                                  
 36710                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36711                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36713                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 36716                                  srinuse:								;AN000;

 36720 00006A59 58                      	POP	AX			      ; 			;AN000;

 36722                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0
 36723 00006A5C 837C4500                	CMP	WORD [SI+curdir.devptr],0     ; dpb ptr =0 ?		;AN000;
 36724 00006A60 7410                    	JZ	short baddrv		      ;     no			;AN000;

 36732 00006A6A EB19                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 36733                                  resetdrv:
 36734                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh									;AN000;
 36735                                  	; 18/12/2022

 36738 00006A70 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;

 36745                                  	;JMP	SHORT ASS_ERR		      ; 			;AN000;

 36754

 36756                                  	;transfer NET_ASSOPER

 36780                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>

 36783                                  ;

 36785                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set

 36787                                  ;		'C' clear

 36877                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 36878                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36879                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 36880                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 36881                                  ;
 36882                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 36883                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 36884                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 36885                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 36886                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 36887                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 36888                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 36889                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 36890                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 36891                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 36892                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 36893                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36894                                  
 36895                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36896                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36897                                  _$UserOper:
 36898                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36899                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 36900 00006AEA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36901 00006AEB 2C01                    	SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 36902 00006AED 58                      	POP	AX
 36903 00006AEE 7211                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 36904 00006AF0 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 36905 00006AF2 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 36906 00006AF4 763D                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 36907                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 36908 00006AF6 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 36909                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 36910                                  	;error	error_invalid_function	; not 0,1,2,3
 36911                                  	;mov	al,1
 36912 00006AFC B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 36913                                  useroper_error:
 36914                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36915                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36916 00006AFE E98C9B                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 36917                                  	;jmp	short ASS_ERR
 36918                                  
 36919                                  UserGet:
 36920                                  ; Transfer MYNAME to DS:DX
 36921                                  ; Set Return CX to MYNUM
 36922 00006B01 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; switch registers
 36923 00006B02 07                      	POP	ES
 36924 00006B03 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX			; destination
 36925 00006B05 368B0E[0E00]            	MOV	CX,[SS:MYNUM]		; Get number	;smr;SS Override
 36926 00006B0A E8BD99                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 36927                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
 36928 00006B0D 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX ; Set number return
 36929 00006B10 16                      	push	ss			; point to DOSDATA
 36930 00006B11 1F                      	pop	ds
 36931 00006B12 BE[0503]                	MOV	SI,MYNAME		; point source to user string
 36932                                  UserMove:
 36933 00006B15 B90F00                  	MOV	CX,15
 36934 00006B18 F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; blam.
 36935 00006B1A 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; 16th byte is 0
 36936 00006B1C AA                      	STOSB
 36937                                  UserBye:
 36938 00006B1D E9649B                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; no errors here
 36939                                  
 36940                                  UserSet:
 36941                                  ; Transfer DS:DX to MYNAME
 36942                                  ; CX to MYNUM
 36943 00006B20 36890E[0E00]            	MOV	[SS:MYNUM],CX				;smr;SS Override
 36944 00006B25 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; user space has source
 36945 00006B27 16                      	push	ss
 36946 00006B28 07                      	pop	es
 36947 00006B29 BF[0503]                	MOV	DI,MYNAME		; point dest to user string
 36948 00006B2C 36FE06[0403]            	INC	byte [SS:DIFFNAM]	; signal change ;smr;SS Override
 36949 00006B31 EBE2                    	JMP	short UserMove

 36960 00006B37 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PRINTER SETUP
 36961                                  			; STACK: WORD function
 36962                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = error code
 36963                                  			; STACK unchanged

 36983                                  ;
 36984                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has drive identifier (0=default)
 36985                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - invalid drive/macro

 36995                                  	; DOSCODE:AA3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 37143                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 37144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37145                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 37146                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 37147                                  ;
 37148                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 37149                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 37150                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 37151                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 37152                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 37153                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 37154                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37156                                  
 37157                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37158                                  TransFCB:
 37159                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37160                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37161                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 37162                                  	;ENTER

 37164 00006BD4 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37165                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 37166 00006BD6 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 37167 00006BD9 16                      	push	ss
 37168 00006BDA 07                      	pop	es
 37169 00006BDB 06                      	push	es

 37171                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37172                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp

 37176 00006BEC E8F3B0                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not

 37237                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 37238                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37239                                  ;
 37240                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 37241                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 37242                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 37243                                  ;       exactly.
 37244                                  ;
 37245                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 37246                                  ;       matches splice.
 37247                                  ;
 37248                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 37249                                  ;
 37250                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 37251                                  ;
 37252                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 37253                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 37254                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 37255                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 37256                                  ;
 37257                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 37258                                  ;
 37259                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 37260                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 37261                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 37262                                  ;
 37263                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 37264                                  ;
 37265                                  ;       if fSharing then
 37266                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37267                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37268                                  ;           splice
 37269                                  ;           fatRead
 37270                                  ;           return
 37271                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 37272                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 37273                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37274                                  ;           return
 37275                                  ;       if device then
 37276                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37277                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37278                                  ;           return
 37279                                  ;       if file then
 37280                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 37281                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 37282                                  ;           Copy current dir
 37283                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 37284                                  ;           splice
 37285                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 37286                                  ;           if local then
 37287                                  ;               fatread
 37288                                  ;           return
 37289                                  ;
 37290                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37291                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 37292                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37293                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 37294                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 37295                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 37296                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 37297                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37298                                  ;
 37299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37300                                  
 37301                                  ; 22/05/2019
 37302                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37303                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37304                                  
 37305                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37306                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37307                                  
 37308                                  TransPath:

 37311                                  TransPathSet:

 37326                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 37327                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 37328                                  ;

 37362                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 37363                                  ; the name if so.
 37364                                  
 37365                                  CheckUNC:
 37366 00006C9A 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override

 37370                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 37371                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name

 37375                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 37376                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 37377                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 37378                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 37379                                  
 37380                                  NO_CHECK:

 37390

 37392                                  ; local machine root path

 37396                                  UNCCpy:

 37401 00006CC6 E87FE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?

 37403 00006CCB AA                      	STOSB

 37432                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37433                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 37434                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 37435                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 37436                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 37437                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 37438                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 37439                                  ;;;
 37440                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 37441                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 37442                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 37443                                  ;;;
 37444                                  ;;;More info:
 37445                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 37446                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 37447                                  ;;;
 37448                                  	call	no5Dshere
 37449                                  start5Dhack:
 37450                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 37451                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 37452                                  
 37453                                  %endif
 37454                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37455                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 37456 00006CE3 E8B9D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 37457                                  
 37458 00006CE6 5D                      	pop	bp
 37459 00006CE7 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 37460 00006CE8 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 37461                                  
 37462                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 37463                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 37464                                  ; call.
 37465                                  
 37466 00006CEA 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 37467 00006CF0 E867FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 37468 00006CF3 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 37469                                  
 37470                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 37471                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 37472                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 37473                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 37474                                  ; a device.
 37475                                  
 37476 00006CF9 E87F02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 37477 00006CFC B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 37478 00006CFE AA                      	STOSB
 37479 00006CFF E849A5                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 37480                                  
 37481 00006D02 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 37482 00006D03 16                      	push	ss
 37483 00006D04 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 37484                                  DoFile_retn:
 37485 00006D05 C3                      	retn
 37486                                  
 37487                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37488                                  %if 0
 37489                                  
 37490                                  no5Dshere:
 37491                                  	; 10/08/2018
 37492                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 37493                                  %endif
 37494                                  
 37495                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 37496                                  
 37497                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 37498                                  
 37499                                  DoFile:
 37500                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37501                                  
 37502 00006D06 E835FE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 37503                                  	;mov	al,3

 37505 00006D0B 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 37506                                  
 37507                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 37508                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 37509                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 37510                                  
 37511                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 37512 00006D0D 1E                      	push	ds
 37513 00006D0E 56                      	push	si
 37514 00006D0F 06                      	push	es
 37515 00006D10 57                      	push	di
 37516 00006D11 E8D4D5                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 37517                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 37518 00006D14 5F                      	pop	di
 37519 00006D15 07                      	pop	es
 37520 00006D16 5E                      	pop	si
 37521 00006D17 1F                      	pop	ds
 37522                                  	;mov	al,3
 37523 00006D18 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37524                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 37525 00006D1A 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 37526                                  
 37527                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 37528                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 37529                                  
 37530 00006D1C 1E                      	push	ds
 37531 00006D1D 56                      	push	si
 37532 00006D1E 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 37533 00006D23 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 37534                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37535 00006D25 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 37536                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 37537 00006D28 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 37538                                  					;AN000;
 37539 00006D2C E82BA5                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 37540 00006D2F 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 37541                                  
 37542                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 37543                                  
 37544 00006D30 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 37545 00006D32 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 37546 00006D36 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 37547 00006D38 AA                      	STOSB
 37548                                  
 37549                                  ; Now get original string.
 37550                                  
 37551                                  GetOrig:
 37552 00006D39 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 37553 00006D3A 5E                      	pop	si
 37554 00006D3B 1F                      	pop	ds
 37555                                  
 37556                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 37557                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 37558                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 37560 00006D3C E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 37561 00006D3F 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 37562 00006D41 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 37563 00006D43 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 37564                                  ;
 37565                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 37566                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 37567                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 37568                                  ;
 37569 00006D45 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 37570                                  SkipPath:
 37571 00006D47 AC                      	LODSB
 37572 00006D48 E8FDE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 37573 00006D4B 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 37574 00006D4D 4E                      	DEC     SI
 37575 00006D4E 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 37576 00006D50 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 37577                                  
 37578                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 37579                                  ; for yucks.
 37580                                  
 37581                                  PathAssure:
 37582 00006D52 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 37583 00006D54 AA                      	STOSB
 37584                                  
 37585                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 37586                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 37587                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 37588                                  
 37589                                  DoCanon:
 37590 00006D55 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 37591                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 37592 00006D58 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 37593                                  
 37594                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 37595                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 37596                                  ; buffer.
 37597                                  
 37598 00006D5A 16                      	push	ss
 37599 00006D5B 1F                      	pop	ds
 37600 00006D5C 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 37601 00006D60 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 37602 00006D64 E81C02                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 37603 00006D67 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 37604                                  
 37605                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 37606                                  
 37607 00006D69 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 37608 00006D6C E8D9E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 37609 00006D6F 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 37610                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 37611 00006D71 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 37612 00006D75 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 37613 00006D77 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 37614 00006D78 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 37615                                  
 37616                                  ; Splice the result.
 37617                                  
 37618                                  DoSplice:
 37619 00006D7D 16                      	push	ss
 37620 00006D7E 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 37621 00006D7F 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 37622 00006D83 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 37623 00006D85 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 37624 00006D8A 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 37625 00006D8C E82A01                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 37626                                  SkipSplice:
 37627                                  
 37628                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 37629                                  ; device.

 37632 00006D90 1F                      	pop	ds
 37633 00006D91 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 37634                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 37635                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37636                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 37637 00006D95 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 37638                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 37639 00006D9A 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 37640 00006D9C E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 37641 00006D9E E8E7A5                  	call	ECritDisk
 37642 00006DA1 E8FAE9                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 37643 00006DA4 E8FCA5                  	call	LCritDisk

 37645 00006DA7 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37646                                  Done:   
 37647 00006DA9 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.

 37649                                  ; 13/07/2018
 37650                                  
 37651                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 37652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37653                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 37654                                  ;
 37655                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37656                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 37657                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 37658                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 37659                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37660                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 37661                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 37662                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 37663                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 37664                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 37665                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37666                                  
 37667                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37668                                  
 37669                                  Canonicalize:
 37670                                  
 37671                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 37672                                  
 37673 00006DAA AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 37674 00006DAB E89AE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 37675 00006DAE 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 37676 00006DB0 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 37677 00006DB2 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 37678 00006DB4 AA                      	STOSB
 37679 00006DB5 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 37680                                  CanonDec:
 37681 00006DB7 4E                      	DEC     SI
 37682                                  
 37683                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 37684                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 37685                                  ; buffer.
 37686                                  
 37687                                  CanonLoop:
 37688                                  
 37689                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 37690                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 37691                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 37692                                  
 37693 00006DB8 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 37694 00006DBA 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 37695 00006DBC 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 37696 00006DBE 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 37697 00006DC3 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 37698 00006DC5 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 37699 00006DC7 AA                      	STOSB
 37700 00006DC8 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 37701                                  DoTerminate:
 37702 00006DCA AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 37703 00006DCB F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 37704 00006DCC C3                      	retn
 37705                                  
 37706                                  CanonBad:
 37707 00006DCD E8CC01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 37708                                  	;mov	al,3

 37713                                  PathEnc:
 37714 00006DD6 F9                      	STC
 37715                                  CanonBad_retn:
 37716 00006DD7 C3                      	retn
 37717                                  
 37718                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 37719                                  ; it to 8.3
 37720                                  
 37721                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 37722 00006DD8 E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 37723 00006DDB 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 37724                                  
 37725                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases.  These will be backed up.
 37726                                  
 37727                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 37728 00006DDD 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 37729 00006DE1 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1

 37731 00006DE3 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 37732 00006DE8 750A                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 37733 00006DEA 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 37734                                  Skip1:

 37736                                  	;mov	al,3
 37737 00006DEE B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37738 00006DF0 72E5                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn
 37739 00006DF2 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 37740                                  
 37741                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 37742                                  
 37743                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 37744 00006DF4 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 37745                                  
 37746                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 37747                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 37748                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 37749                                  
 37750                                  CanonPath:
 37751 00006DF6 E81600                  	CALL    PathSep

 37753                                  
 37754                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 37755

 37762                                  
 37763                                  ; Skip all remaining path chars
 37764                                  
 37765                                  CanonPathLoop:

 37768 00006E0A 74FA                    	JZ	short CanonPathLoop	; yep, grab another
 37769 00006E0C 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up
 37770 00006E0D EBA9                    	JMP	short  CanonLoop	; go copy component
 37771                                  
 37772                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 37773                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37774                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 37775                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 37776                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 37777                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 37778                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise
 37779                                  ;   Registers modified: AL
 37780                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37781                                  
 37782                                  PathSep:

 37784                                  PathSepGotCh:				; already have character

 37790 00006E15 E930E3                  	jmp	PATHCHRCMP

 37793                                  ;BREAK <SkipBack - move backwards to a path separator>
 37794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37795                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 37797                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 37798                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char
 37799                                  ;               AL has char from output ES:DI (path sep if carry clear)
 37800                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup
 37801                                  ;               Carry Clear if ok

 37804                                  
 37805                                  SkipBack:
 37806 00006E18 39DF                    	CMP     DI,BX                   ;   while (TRUE) {
 37807 00006E1A 720B                    	JB	short SkipBad		;       if (d < dlim)
 37808 00006E1C 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           goto err;

 37810 00006E20 E825E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ;           break;
 37811 00006E23 75F3                    	JNZ	short SkipBack		;       }
 37812 00006E25 F8                      	CLC                             ;   return (0);
 37813 00006E26 C3                      	retn				;
 37814                                  SkipBad:                                ;err:
 37815                                  	;mov	al,3
 37816 00006E27 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; bad path error
 37817 00006E29 F9                      	STC                             ;   return (-1);
 37818 00006E2A C3                      	retn				;

 37820                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 37821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37822                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 37823                                  ;
 37824                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 37825                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 37826                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 37827                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 37828                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 37829                                  ;                   CX has length of destination
 37830                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,CX,DX
 37831                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37832                                  
 37833                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37834                                  
 37835                                  CopyComponent:
 37836                                  
 37837                                  %define CopyBP	 [BP]		; word
 37838                                  %define CopyD	 [BP+2]		; dword
 37839                                  %define CopyDoff [BP+2]		; word
 37840                                  %define CopyS	 [BP+6]		; dword
 37841                                  %define CopySoff [BP+6]		; word

 37844 00006E2B 83EC0E                  	SUB     SP,14                   ; room for temp buffer
 37845 00006E2E 1E                      	push	ds

 37848 00006E31 57                      	push	di

 37855 00006E3B 7518                    	JNZ	short NormalComp
 37856 00006E3D E8CFFF                  	CALL    PathSep                 ;       if (!pathsep(*s))
 37857 00006E40 740B                    	JZ	short NulTerm

 37860 00006E43 AA                      	STOSB

 37863 00006E48 E8C4FF                  	CALL    PathSep

 37865                                  NulTerm:                                ;               return -1;
 37866 00006E4D 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL                   ;       *d++ = 0;
 37867 00006E4F AA                      	STOSB

 37869 00006E53 EB47                    	JMP     SHORT _GoodRet		;       }
 37870                                  NormalComp:                             ;   else {
 37871 00006E55 8B7606                  	MOV     SI,CopySoff ; [bp+6]
 37872 00006E58 E82BE2                  	call	NameTrans               ;       s = NameTrans (s, Name1);
 37873 00006E5B 3B7606                  	CMP     SI,CopySoff             ;       if (s == CopySOff)
 37874 00006E5E 743F                    	JZ	short CopyBad		;           return (-1);
 37875 00006E60 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	;       if (!fSharing) {;smr;SS Override
 37876 00006E66 7510                    	JNZ	short DoPack
 37877 00006E68 80E201                  	AND     DL,1                    ;           cMeta += fMeta;
 37878 00006E6B 360016[7A05]            	ADD	[ss:CMETA],DL		;           if (cMeta > 0);smr;SS Override
 37879 00006E70 7F2D                    	JG	short CopyBad		;               return (-1);

 37936                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 37937                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37938                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 37939                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 37940                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 37941                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 37942                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 37943                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 37944                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 37945                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 37946                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 37947                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 37948                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 37949                                  ;                   left alone

 37952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 37971                                  	;;test	word [si+67],2000h
 37972                                  	;TEST	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 37973 00006EDC 74F3                    	JZ	short SpliceScan 	;       if ( Spliced (i) ) {
 37974 00006EDE 57                      	push	di
 37975 00006EDF E8A100                  	CALL    PathPref                ;           if (!PathPref (s, d))
 37976 00006EE2 7403                    	JZ	short SpliceFound	;
 37977                                  SpliceSkip:
 37978 00006EE4 5F                      	pop	di
 37979 00006EE5 EBEA                    	JMP	short SpliceScan	;               continue;
 37980                                  SpliceFound:
 37981 00006EE7 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		;           if (*s || NoSetDir) {
 37982 00006EEB 7508                    	JNZ	short SpliceDo
 37983 00006EED 36F606[4C03]FF          	TEST	byte [ss:NoSetDir],-1			;smr;SS Override
 37984 00006EF3 75EF                    	JNZ	short SpliceSkip

 37990 00006EFA E88000                  	CALL	TextFromDrive1          ;               src = TextFromDrive1(src,i);
 37991 00006EFD 36A1[B605]              	MOV     AX,[SS:CURR_DIR_END]			;smr;SS Override
 37992 00006F01 09C0                    	OR      AX,AX
 37993 00006F03 7808                    	JS	short NoPoke

 37995 00006F07 29F0                    	SUB     AX,SI
 37996 00006F09 36A3[B605]              	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],AX			;smr;SS Override

 37998 00006F0D 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		;               if (*p)
 37999 00006F10 7503                    	JNZ	short SpliceCopy	;                   *src++ = '\\';
 38000 00006F12 B05C                    	MOV     AL,"\"
 38001 00006F14 AA                      	STOSB

 38003 00006F15 E842A3                  	call	FStrCpy

 38005 00006F1B 80C901                  	OR      CL,1                    ; signal splice done.
 38006 00006F1E EB0C                    	JMP     SHORT DoSet             ;               return;
 38007                                  SpliceDone:                             ;               }
 38008 00006F20 368F06[A405]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS+2]     ;   ThisCDS = TmpCDS;
 38009 00006F25 368F06[A205]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS]			;smr;SS Override
 38010                                  AllDone:

 38027                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 38028                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38029                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 38030                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 38031                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 38032                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 38033                                  ;
 38034                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 38035                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 38036                                  ;   Outputs:
 38037                                  ;       Carry Clear
 38038                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 38039                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 38040                                  ;       Carry Set
 38041                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 38042                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 38051                                  	
 38052                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 38054                                  ;

 38056                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 38057                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 38058                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 38059                                  ; and restore CX.
 38060                                  
 38061                                  	;mov	ch,16h

 38063 00006F46 E8BA02                  	call	SetAttrib

 38069 00006F4C E8E6FC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 38070 00006F4F 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 38071 00006F50 5F                      	pop     di
 38072 00006F51 07                      	pop	es
 38073 00006F52 5E                      	pop     si
 38074 00006F53 1F                      	pop     ds
 38075 00006F54 7303                    	JNC	short TransOK
 38076 00006F56 E93497                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR

 38086                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38088                                  ;   pointer.

 38110                                  ;Break   <TextFromDrive - convert a drive number to a text string>
 38111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 38113                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 38114                                  ;

 38130                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 38131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38132                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 38133                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 38134                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 38135                                  ;
 38136                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 38137                                  ;               ES:DI string
 38138                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 38139                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 38140                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 38141                                  ;   Registers modified: CX

 38144                                  PathPref:

 38146 00006F86 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 38147 00006F87 F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 38148 00006F89 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 38149 00006F8B 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 38150 00006F8C 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 38151 00006F8F E8B6E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 38152 00006F92 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 38153                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 38155 00006F97 E877FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 38156                                  Prefix:
 38157 00006F9A 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 38158 00006F9B C3                      	retn

 38191                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 38192                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 38193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38194                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 38195                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 38196                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 38197                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 38198                                  ;           INT     int_command
 38199                                  ;
 38200                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 38201                                  ;       ------          --------
 38202                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 38203                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 38204                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 38205                                  ;
 38206                                  ;   Error returns:
 38207                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 38208                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 38209                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 38210                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 38211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38212                                  
 38213                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38214                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 38215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38216                                  ;
 38217                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 38218                                  ;
 38219                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 38220                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 38221                                  ;
 38222                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 38223                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 38224                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38225                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 38226                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38227                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 38228                                  ;	USES	all
 38229                                  ;
 38230                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38231                                  
 38232                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38233                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38234                                  
 38235                                  _$OPEN:       
 38236 00006FA5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 38237                                  _$Open2:
 38238                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38239 00006FA7 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38240 00006FA9 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 38241 00006FAC B9[DA2B]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 38242                                  
 38243                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38244                                  
 38245 00006FAF 50                      	push	ax
 38246                                  
 38247                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 38248                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 38249                                  ;
 38250                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 38251                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 38252                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 38253                                  ;
 38254                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 38255                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 38256                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 38257                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 38258                                  
 38259                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 38260                                  
 38261                                  AccessFile:
 38262 00006FB0 E8D5A3                  	call	ECritSFT
 38263 00006FB3 E8D3F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 38264 00006FB6 E8EAA3                  	call	LCritSFT
 38265 00006FB9 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 38266 00006FBB 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 38267 00006FC0 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 38268 00006FC5 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 38269                                  
 38270                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 38271                                  
 38272 00006FCA E8A9F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 38273 00006FCD 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 38274                                  OpenFailJ:
 38275 00006FCF E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 38276                                  
 38277                                  SaveJFN:
 38278 00006FD2 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 38279 00006FD7 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 38280 00006FDC 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 38281                                  
 38282                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 38283                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 38284                                  
 38285 00006FE1 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 38286 00006FE6 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 38287 00006FE9 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 38288 00006FEB BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 38289 00006FEE 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 38290 00006FEF E843FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 38291 00006FF2 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 38292                                  
 38293 00006FF3 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 38294 00006FF8 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 38295 00006FFA 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 38296 00007000 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 38297                                  	;mov	al,2
 38298 00007002 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 38299                                  OpenCleanJ:
 38300 00007004 EB50                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 38301                                  
 38302                                  SetSearch:
 38303 00007006 58                      	pop	ax			; Mode (Open), Attributes (Create)
 38304                                  
 38305                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 38306                                  
 38307 00007007 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 38308                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38309                                  	;mov	[si+2],cx ; 0
 38310 00007009 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],cx ; initialize mode field to 0
 38311                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0
 38312 0000700C 894C33                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],cx	 ; clean out sharing info
 38313                                  	;
 38314 0000700F 81FB[DA2B]              	CMP	BX,DOS_OPEN
 38315 00007013 7509                    	JNZ	short _DoOper
 38316                                  	;test   al,80h
 38317 00007015 A880                    	test	AL,SHARING_NO_INHERIT	; look for no inher
 38318 00007017 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018
 38319 00007019 247F                    	AND	AL,7Fh			; mask off inherit bit
 38320                                  	;mov	cx,1000h
 38321 0000701B B90010                  	MOV	CX,sf_no_inherit
 38322                                  _DoOper:
 38323                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 38324                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 38325                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 38326                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0

 38709                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 38710                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38711                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 38712                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 38713                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 38714                                  ;
 38715                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 38716                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 38717                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 38718                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 38719                                  ;		Carry Set:
 38720                                  ;		    AX has error code
 38721                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 38722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38723                                  
 38724                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 38725 00007165 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack

 38728                                  
 38729                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 38730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38731                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 38732                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 38733                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 38734                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 38735                                  ;
 38736                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 38737                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 38738                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 38739                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 38740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38741                                  
 38742                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38743                                  ;BinToAscii:
 38744                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 38745                                  ;bta5:
 38746                                  ;	push    cx
 38747                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 38748                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 38749                                  ;	push    ax
 38750                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 38751                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 38752                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 38753                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 38754                                  ;	add     al,7
 38755                                  ;bta6: 
 38756                                  ;	stosb
 38757                                  ;	pop     ax
 38758                                  ;	pop     cx
 38759                                  ;	loop    bta5
 38760                                  ;	retn
 38761                                  
 38762                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38763                                  BinToAscii:
 38764 0000716C B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 38765                                  bta5:	
 38766 0000716F D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 38767 00007171 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 38768 00007172 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 38769 00007174 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 38770 00007176 AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 38771 00007177 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 38772 00007178 FECD                    	dec	ch
 38773 0000717A 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 38774 0000717C C3                      	retn
 38775                                  
 38776                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 38777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38778                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 38779                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 38780                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 38781                                  ;
 38782                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 38783                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 38784                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 38785                                  ;		AX has handle
 38786                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 38787                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38788                                  
 38789                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38790                                  
 38791                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 38792                                  	;Enter
 38793 0000717D 55                      	push	bp
 38794 0000717E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 38795                                  
 38796                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 38797                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 38798                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 38799
