 41126                                  
 41127                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41128                                  chk_common_str:
 41129 00007701 BE[F275]                	mov	si,scan_com
 41130                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 41131                                  	;mov	cx,32
 41132 00007704 B92000                  	mov	cx,size_scan_com
 41133                                  
 41134 00007707 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb	       
 41135                                  
 41136                                  					; M046 - start
 41137                                  	; a fourth possible version of these exepacked programs have a 
 41138                                  	; 056h instead of 06Bh. See scan_com above
 41139                                  	;
 41140                                  	; 	db  75h, 6Bh		;jne CorruptExe		
 41141                                  	;
 41142                                  	; If the mismatch at this point is due to a 56h instead of 6Bh 
 41143                                  	; we shall try to match the rest of the string
 41144                                  	;
 41145                                  
 41146 00007709 7409                    	jz	short ccs_done
 41147 0000770B 26807DFF56              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],56h
 41148 00007710 7502                    	jnz	short ccs_done
 41149                                  
 41150 00007712 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb	    
 41151                                  ccs_done:				; M046 - end
 41152 00007714 C3                      	retn
 41153                                  
 41154                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41155                                  ;
 41156                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 41157                                  ;
 41158                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 41159                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 41160                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 41161                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 41162                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 41163                                  ;
 41164                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 41165                                  ;				NC
 41166                                  ;			  else
 41167                                  ;				CY
 41168                                  ;
 41169                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 41170                                  ;
 41171                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41172                                  
 41173                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41174                                  chk_patchsum:
 41175 00007715 57                      	push	di
 41176                                  
 41177 00007716 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb			   
 41178                                  
 41179 00007718 751A                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 41180                                  					; N: exit
 41181                                  					; Y:	
 41182                                  
 41183                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the 
 41184                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 41185                                  		; unpacking code.
 41186                                  
 41187 0000771A 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 41188 0000771F 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 41189                                  
 41190 00007721 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 41191 00007723 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 41192                                  ep_chksum:
 41193 00007725 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 41194 00007728 83C702                  	add	di,2
 41195 0000772B E2F8                    	loop	ep_chksum
 41196                                  
 41197 0000772D 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 41198                                  
 41199 0000772E 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 41200 00007730 7502                    	jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 41201                                  					; Y: 
 41202 00007732 F8                      	clc	
 41203 00007733 C3                      	retn
 41204                                  
 41205                                  cp_fail:
 41206 00007734 F9                      	stc
 41207 00007735 C3                      	retn
 41208                                  
 41209                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 41210                                  ;
 41211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41212                                  ;
 41213                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 41214                                  ;
 41215                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 41216                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 41217                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 41218                                  ;
 41219                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 41220                                  ;
 41221                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 41222                                  ;90		even				; word align
 41223                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 41224                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 41225                                  ;
 41226                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 41227                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 41228                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 41229                                  ; a mov & loop.
 41230                                  ;
 41231                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 41232                                  ; ====================================
 41233                                  ;
 41234                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 41235                                  ;
 41236                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 41237                                  ; ------				--------
 41238                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 41239                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 41240                                  ;
 41241                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 41242                                  ;
 41243                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 41244                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 41245                                  ;
 41246                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 41247                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 41248                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 41249                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 41250                                  ;
 41251                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 41252                                  ;				from the program image
 41253                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 41254                                  ;
 41255                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 41256                                  ;
 41257                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41258                                  
 41259                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41260                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41261                                  
 41262                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41263                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41264                                  
 41265                                  RScanPattern1:
 41266 00007736 000020000000400001-     	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 41266 0000773F 00                 
 41267                                  
 41268                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 41269                                  
 41270                                  RScanPattern2:
 41271 00007740 8B0E100090E2FEE8        	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41272                                  
 41273                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41274                                  
 41275                                  RScanPattern3:
 41276 00007748 8B0E1000E2FEE8          	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41277                                  
 41278                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41279                                  
 41280                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41281                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41282                                  
 41283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41284                                  ;
 41285                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 41286                                  ;
 41287                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41288                                  
 41289                                  RationalPatch:
 41290 0000774F FC                      	cld
 41291 00007750 50                      	push	ax
 41292 00007751 53                      	push	bx
 41293 00007752 51                      	push	cx
 41294 00007753 52                      	push	dx
 41295 00007754 56                      	push	si
 41296 00007755 57                      	push	di
 41297 00007756 06                      	push	es
 41298 00007757 1E                      	push	ds			; we use all of them
 41299 00007758 BF0A00                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 41300 0000775B 0E                      	push	cs
 41301 0000775C 1F                      	pop	ds
 41302                                  	
 41303 0000775D BE[3677]                	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 41304                                  	;mov	cx,10
 41305 00007760 B90A00                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 41306 00007763 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 41307 00007765 754A                    	jne	short rpexit
 41308 00007767 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]
 41309 0000776B 3D5C01                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 41310 0000776E 7241                    	jb	short rpexit
 41311 00007770 3D7F01                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 41312 00007773 773C                    	ja	short rpexit
 41313                                  
 41314 00007775 E85A00                  	call	VerifyVersion
 41315 00007778 7537                    	jne	short rpexit
 41316                                  
 41317 0000777A 268B0E1600              	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 41318 0000777F 81E90002                	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 41319                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 41320 00007783 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 41321 00007788 BE[4077]                	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 41322                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 41323 0000778B BA0800                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 41324 0000778E E82900                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 41325 00007791 740B                    	jz	short rpfound
 41326                                  
 41327 00007793 BE[4877]                	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 41328                                  	;mov	dx,15
 41329 00007796 BA0F00                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 41330 00007799 E81E00                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 41331 0000779C 7513                    	jnz	short rpexit
 41332                                  
 41333                                  rpfound:
 41334                                  	
 41335                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 41336                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 41337                                  
 41338 0000779E B09A                    	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 41339 000077A0 AA                      	stosb
 41340 000077A1 B8[1612]                	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 41341 000077A4 AB                      	stosw
 41342 000077A5 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 41343 000077A7 AB                      	stosw
 41344 000077A8 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41345 000077AA 83E906                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 41346 000077AD B090                    	mov	al,90h
 41347 000077AF F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 41348                                  rpexit:
 41349 000077B1 1F                      	pop	ds
 41350 000077B2 07                      	pop	es
 41351 000077B3 5F                      	pop	di
 41352 000077B4 5E                      	pop	si
 41353 000077B5 5A                      	pop	dx
 41354 000077B6 59                      	pop	cx
 41355 000077B7 5B                      	pop	bx
 41356 000077B8 58                      	pop	ax
 41357 000077B9 C3                      	retn
 41358                                  
 41359                                  ; M020 END
 41360                                  
 41361                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41362                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41363

 41366                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41367                                  ;
 41368                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 41369                                  ;
 41370                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 41371                                  ;
 41372                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 41373                                  ;
 41374                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41375                                  
 41376                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 41377                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41378 000077BA BF0002                  	mov	di,200h
 41379                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 41380 000077BD 51                      	push	cx
 41381 000077BE 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx
 41382 000077C0 41                      	inc	cx
 41383                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41384                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41385                                  	;mov	di,200h
 41386                                  scsagain:
 41387 000077C1 56                      	push	si
 41388 000077C2 57                      	push	di
 41389 000077C3 51                      	push	cx
 41390 000077C4 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41391 000077C6 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 41392 000077C8 59                      	pop	cx
 41393 000077C9 5F                      	pop	di
 41394 000077CA 5E                      	pop	si
 41395 000077CB 7403                    	je	short scsfound
 41396 000077CD 47                      	inc	di
 41397 000077CE E2F1                    	loop	scsagain
 41398                                  scsfound:
 41399 000077D0 59                      	pop	cx
 41400                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 41401 000077D1 C3                      	retn
 41402

 41404                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41405                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41406

 41409                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41410                                  ;
 41411                                  ; VerifyVersion
 41412                                  ;
 41413                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 41414                                  ; from ES:2A.
 41415                                  ;
 41416                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 41417                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 41418                                  ;
 41419                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41420                                  
 41421                                  VerifyVersion:
 41422 000077D2 268B362A00              	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 41423                                  					;  in ascii
 41424 000077D7 B30A                    	mov	bl,10
 41425 000077D9 83C603                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 41426                                  
 41427 000077DC E80E00                  	call	VVDigit
 41428 000077DF 75F0                    	jne	short vvexit
 41429 000077E1 E80900                  	call	VVDigit
 41430 000077E4 75EB                    	jne	short vvexit
 41431 000077E6 26803C2E                	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 41432 000077EA 75E5                    	jne	short vvexit
 41433 000077EC 4E                      	dec	si
 41434                                  	;call	VVDigit
 41435                                  	; 18/12/2022
 41436                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 41437                                  ;vvexit:
 41438                                  	;retn
 41439                                  VVDigit:
 41440 000077ED F6F3                    	div	bl
 41441 000077EF 80C430                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 41442 000077F2 4E                      	dec	si
 41443 000077F3 26386401                	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 41444 000077F7 B400                    	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 41445 000077F9 C3                      	retn

 41448                                  ;
 41449                                  ;	M068
 41450                                  ;
 41451                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 41452                                  ;
 41453                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 41454                                  ;
 41455                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 41456                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 41457                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 41458                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 41459                                  ;
 41460                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 41461                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 41462                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 41463                                  ;				to the user. 
 41464                                  ;
 41465                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 41466                                  ;
 41467                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41468                                  
 41469                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41470                                  
 41471                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 41472                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 41473                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 41474                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 41475                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 41476                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 41477                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 41478                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 41479                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 41480                                  
 41481                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41482                                  
 41483                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41484                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41485

 41488 000077FE 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 41489 00007802 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 41490 00007808 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 41491 0000780C B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 41492 0000780F BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 41493

 41495

 42425                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42426                                  ;
 42427                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 42428                                  ;
 42429                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 42430                                  ;
 42431                                  ;	USED:	none
 42432                                  ;
 42433                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42434                                  
 42435                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 42436                                  ;
 42437                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 42438                                  ;
 42439 00007B4B 50                      	push	ax
 42440                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 42441 00007B4C B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 42442 00007B4F CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42443                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 42444                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 42445                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 42446 00007B51 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 42447 00007B53 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 42448                                  ;
 42449                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 42450                                  ; need to call it later.
 42451                                  ;
 42452 00007B55 53                      	push	bx
 42453 00007B56 52                      	push	dx
 42454 00007B57 1E                      	push	ds
 42455 00007B58 06                      	push	es
 42456                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 42457 00007B59 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 42458 00007B5C CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42459                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 42460                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 42461                                  
 42462 00007B5E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42463                                  
 42464 00007B63 891E[6311]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 42465 00007B67 8C06[6511]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 42466                                  cXMMexit:
 42467 00007B6B F8                      	clc
 42468 00007B6C 07                      	pop	es
 42469 00007B6D 1F                      	pop	ds
 42470 00007B6E 5A                      	pop	dx
 42471 00007B6F 5B                      	pop	bx
 42472 00007B70 58                      	pop	ax
 42473 00007B71 C3                      	retn				; done
 42474                                  ;
 42475                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 42476                                  ;
 42477                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 42478 00007B72 F9                      	stc
 42479 00007B73 58                      	pop	ax
 42480 00007B74 C3                      	retn

 42482                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42483                                  ;
 42484                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 42485                                  ;
 42486                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 42487                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 42488                                  ;
 42489                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 42490                                  ;		   if AX =0
 42491                                  ;		      if first entry
 42492                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 42493                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 42494                                  ;		      else
 42495                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 42496                                  ;
 42497                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 42498                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES	
 42499                                  ;
 42500                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 42501                                  ;
 42502                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 42503                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42504                                  
 42505 00007B75 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 42506                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 42507                                  
 42508                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 42509                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 42510                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 42511                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 42512                                  
 42513                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 42514 00007B76 1E                      	push	ds
 42515                                  
 42516 00007B77 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42517                                  
 42518 00007B7C E8B500                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 42519                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 42520                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42521                                  	; cx = 0
 42522 00007B7F 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 42523                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 42524 00007B81 756C                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 42525                                  
 42526                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42527 00007B83 2E380E[757B]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 42528                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this 
 42529 00007B88 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 42530                                  					;    segment in ES
 42531                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub 
 42532 00007B8A 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 42533 00007B8C E86D00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 42534 00007B8F E8EC00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 42535                                  					; with those in the stub.
 42536                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42537                                  	; cx = 0
 42538                                  second_entry:
 42539 00007B92 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 42540                                  
 42541                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 42542                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 42543 00007B94 BF[6210]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 42544                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42545                                  	; cx = 0
 42546                                  	;mov	cx,9
 42547 00007B97 B109                    	mov	cl,9
 42548 00007B99 1E                      	push	ds			
 42549 00007B9A 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 42550                                  
 42551                                  dosinttabloop:
 42552 00007B9B 83C702                  	add	di,2
 42553 00007B9E AB                      	stosw
 42554 00007B9F E2FA                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 42555                                  
 42556                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 42557                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 42558                                  
 42559                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 42560 00007BA1 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 42561 00007BA4 724E                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 42562                                  ;endif
 42563 00007BA6 E8A2FF                  	call	check_XMM		; Y: set up the XMS entry point
 42564 00007BA9 7249                    	jc	short sr_done		; failed to set up XMS do not do
 42565                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 42566                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42567                                  	; cx = 0
 42568 00007BAB E84B01                  	call	patch_in_nops		; enable the stub to check A20 state
 42569                                  ; M021-
 42570                                  	;mov	byte [1211h],1
 42571 00007BAE C606[1112]01            	mov	byte [DosHasHMA],1	; set flag telling DOS control of HMA 
 42572                                  				
 42573                                  					; set pointer to the routine that 
 42574                                  					; patches buggy exepacked code.
 42575                                  	;mov	[FixExePatch],offset DOSCODE:ExePatch
 42576 00007BB3 C706[1212][1276]        	mov	word [FixExePatch],ExePatch
 42577                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine 
 42578                                  					; M068: that detects copy protected
 42579                                  					; M068: apps
 42580                                  	;mov	[ChkCopyProt],offset DOSCODE:IsCopyProt
 42581 00007BB9 C706[6100][1278]        	mov	word [ChkCopyProt],IsCopyProt
 42582                                  
 42583                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDF1h
 42584                                  
 42585                                  ;	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42586                                  ;
 42587                                  ;; M020 - begin
 42588                                  ;
 42589                                  ;	call	WhatCPUType
 42590                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 42591                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42592                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 42593                                  ;	;mov	[RationalPatchPtr],offset DOSCODE:RationalPatch
 42594                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42595                                  ;
 42596                                  ;; M020 - end
 42597                                  ;
 42598                                  ;	jmp	short sr_done
 42599                                  ;
 42600                                  ;patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42601                                  ;	mov	ax,es
 42602                                  ;	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42603                                  ;					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42604                                  ;					; offsets as they have been already
 42605                                  ;					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42606                                  ;					; DOSINIT.
 42607                                  ;sr_done:
 42608                                  ;	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42609                                  ;	pop	ds
 42610                                  ;	retf	; ! far return !
 42611                                  
 42612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42613                                  ;
 42614                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 42615                                  ;
 42616                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 42617                                  ;
 42618                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 42619                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 42620                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 42621                                  ;
 42622                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 42623                                  ;
 42624                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42625                                  
 42626                                  WhatCPUType:
 42627                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42628                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 42629                                  
 42630                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 42631                                  
 42632                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 42633                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 42634                                  ;
 42635                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 42636                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 42637                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 42638                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 42639                                  
 42640                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42641                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 42642                                  
 42643                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 42644 00007BBF 9C                      	pushf
 42645 00007BC0 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 42646 00007BC1 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 42647                                  
 42648 00007BC3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 42649 00007BC5 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 42650 00007BC6 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 42651 00007BC7 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 42652 00007BC8 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 42653 00007BC9 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 42654 00007BCC 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 42655 00007BCF 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 42656                                  
 42657 00007BD1 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 42658 00007BD4 50                      	push	ax
 42659 00007BD5 9D                      	popf
 42660 00007BD6 9C                      	pushf
 42661 00007BD7 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 42662 00007BD8 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 42663 00007BDB 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 42664                                  
 42665                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 42666 00007BDD 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 42667                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 42668 00007BDE 43                      	inc	bx
 42669                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 42670 00007BDF 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 42671 00007BE1 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 42672 00007BE2 9D                      	popf
 42673                                  	
 42674                                  	;endm
 42675                                  
 42676                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42677                                  	;retn
 42678                                  
 42679                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42680                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 42681 00007BE3 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 42682 00007BE5 750D                    	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42683                                  					;  on 286 systems
 42684 00007BE7 C706[1412][4F77]        	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42685                                  
 42686 00007BED EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done
 42687                                  
 42688                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42689 00007BEF 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 42690 00007BF1 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42691                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42692                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 42693                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42694                                  					; DOSINIT.
 42695                                  sr_done:
 42696 00007BF4 2EC606[757B]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42697 00007BFA 1F                      	pop	ds
 42698 00007BFB CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 42699                                  
 42700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42701                                  ;
 42702                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 42703                                  ;
 42704                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 42705                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA

 42708                                  ;

 42724

 42726

 42738                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 42739                                  
 42740                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42742                                  	;inc	di

 42744

 42746 00007C0C 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 42747

 42749 00007C10 83C706                  	add	di,6			; skip int 24h
 42750                                  
 42751                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 42752                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42753                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 42754                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42755 00007C13 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 42756                                  ps_set2:
 42757 00007C15 AB                      	stosw

 42759                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42760 00007C16 47                      	inc	di

 42763

 42765                                  					;   already be set.
 42766                                  	; 04/11/2022

 42768                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42770                                  ps_set3:

 42773                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42777

 42782

 42794                                  
 42795                                  ; set offset of int2f

 42799                                  ;endif

 42802                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42805 00007C33 C3                      	retn

 43047                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43048                                  ;
 43049                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 43050                                  ;
 43051                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 43052                                  ;
 43053                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 43054                                  ;
 43055                                  ;	Description:
 43056                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 43057                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 43058                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 43059                                  ;
 43060                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43061                                  
 43062                                  	; 04/11/2022
 43063                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43064                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 43065                                  
 43066                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 43067                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 43068                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 43069                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 43070                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 43071                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 43072                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 43073                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 43074                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 43075 00007CE9 [8A10]                  	dw	i0patch
 43076 00007CEB [9410]                  	dw	i20patch
 43077 00007CED [9E10]                  	dw	i21patch

 43293                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 43294                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 43295                                  ;;
 43296                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 43297                                  ;;
 43298                                  ;;	on return:
 43299                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 43300                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 43301                                  ;;
 43302                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 43303                                  ;;
 43304                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43305                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43306                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 43307                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 43308                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 43309                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 43310                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 43311                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 43312                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 43313                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 43314                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 43315                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 43316                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 43317                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 43318                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 43319                                  ;;
 43320                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 43528                                  ;============================================================================
 43529                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43530                                  ;============================================================================
 43531                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 43532                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 43533                                  
 43534                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 43535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43536                                  
 43537                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 43538                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 43539                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 43540                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 43541                                  ;
 43542                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 43543                                  ; describing that data item.
 43544                                  
 43545                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43546                                  
 43547                                  ;
 43548                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 43549                                  ;
 43550                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 43551                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 43552                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 43553                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 43554                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 43555                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 43556                                  ;
 43557                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 43558                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 43559                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 43560                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 43561                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 43562                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 43563                                  ;   as EOF).
 43564                                  
 43565                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 43566                                  
 43567                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 43568                                  
 43569                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table

 43791                                  ;============================================================================
 43792                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43793                                  ;============================================================================
 43794                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 43795                                  
 43796                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 43797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 43798                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 43799                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 43800                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 43801                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 43802                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 43803                                  ; **********************************************************
 43804                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 43805                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 43806                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 43807                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 43808                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 43809                                  ; **********************************************************	
 43810                                  
 43811                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 43812                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43813                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43814                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 43815                                  
 43816                                  ; 	ORG     0
 43817                                  
 43818                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 43819                                  
 43820                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 43821                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 43822 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 43823 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 43824                                  
 43825                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 43826                                  
 43827                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 43828                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 43829 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 43830                                  RENBUF:	
 43831 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 43832                                  
 43833                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 43834                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 43835 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 43836                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 43837 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 43838                                  
 43839                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 43840                                   
 43841                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 43842                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 43843                                  
 43844                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 43845                                  
 43846                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 43847                                  
 43848                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 43849                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 43850                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 43851                                  
 43852                                  NAME1:	
 43853 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 43854                                  NAME2:
 43855 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 43856                                  DESTSTART:

 43859                                  	;times	5  db	0

 43861                                  
 43862                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 43863

 44068                                  ; Say What????!!! This does NOT go into the swappable area!
 44069                                  ; NOTE: We include the decl of ibmpatch in ms-dos even though it is not needed.
 44070                                  ;       This allows the REDIRector to work on either IBM or MS-DOS.
 44071

 44261                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 44262                                  
 44263                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44264                                  ;
 44265                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 44266                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 44267                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 44268                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 44269                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 44270                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44271                                  ; Example:
 44272                                  
 44273                                  MAP_CASE:
 44274                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 44275                                  
 44276 00000CF5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 44277 00000CF7 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 44278 00000CF9 CB                      	RETF
 44279                                  Map1:
 44280 00000CFA 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 44281 00000CFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 44282 00000CFD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 44283 00000CFE BB[AF0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 44284                                  FINISH:
 44285 00000D01 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 44286 00000D02 1F                      	POP	DS
 44287 00000D03 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 44288 00000D04 5B                      	POP	BX
 44289 00000D05 1F                      	POP	DS
 44290                                  L_RET:	
 44291 00000D06 CB                      	RETF
 44292                                  
 44293                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 44294

 44539                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 44540                                  ; 
 44541                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 44542                                  ;
 44543                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 44544                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 44545                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 44546                                  ;
 44547                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 44548                                  ;
 44549                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 44550                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 44551                                  ;
 44552                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 44553                                  ;
 44554                                  ;############################################################################
 44555                                  
 44556                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 44557                                  
 44558                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44559                                  
 44560                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44561                                  ;
 44562                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 44563                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 44564                                  ;
 44565                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 44566                                  ;
 44567                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 44568                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 44569                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 44570                                  ;
 44571                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44572                                  
 44573                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 44574                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 44575                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 44576                                  ;ELSE
 44577                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 44578                                  ;ENDIF
 44579                                  ;ENDM
 44580

 44859                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44860                                  ; 04/11/2022
 44861                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44862                                  
 44863                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44864                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 44865                                  ;
 44866                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 44867                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 44868                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 44869                                  ;
 44870                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 44871                                  ;
 44872                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 44873                                  ;
 44874                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44875                                  
 44876 00001044 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 44877 0000104A 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 44878 0000104C 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 44879 00001051 CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h

 44884                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 44885                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in

 44949                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44950                                  ;
 44951                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 44952                                  ;
 44953                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 44954                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 44955                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 44956                                  ;
 44957                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 44958                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 44959                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 44960                                  ;	   4. else 
 44961                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 44962                                  ;	   6. endif
 44963                                  ;	7. else
 44964                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 44965                                  ;	9. endif
 44966                                  ;
 44967                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44968                                  
 44969                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44970                                  
 44971                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44972                                  
 44973                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44974                                  ;
 44975                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 44976                                  ;
 44977                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44978                                  
 44979                                  ldivov:
 44980                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44981                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44982                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44983                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44984                                  i0patch:
 44985 0000108A EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont	
 44986                                  
 44987 0000108C E8E000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44988                                  divov_cont:
 44989 0000108F 2EFF2E[6210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 44990                                  
 44991                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44992                                  ;
 44993                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 44994                                  ;
 44995                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 44996                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 44997                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 44998                                  ; will be restored then.
 44999                                  ;
 45000                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45001                                  
 45002                                  lquit:
 45003                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45004                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45005                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45006                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45007                                  i20patch:
 45008 00001094 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont	
 45009                                  
 45010 00001096 E8D600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45011                                  quit_cont:
 45012 00001099 2EFF2E[6610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 45013                                  
 45014                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45015                                  ;
 45016                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 45017                                  ;
 45018                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45019                                  
 45020                                  lcommand:

 45031                                  
 45032                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45033                                  ;
 45034                                  ; INT 25 
 45035                                  ;
 45036                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45037                                  
 45038                                  labsdrd:
 45039                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45040                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45041                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45042                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45043                                  i25patch:
 45044 000010A8 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont

 45047                                  absdrd_cont:

 45049

 45078                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys

 45085

 45087                                  ;
 45088                                  ; INT 2f
 45089                                  ;
 45090                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45091                                  
 45092                                  lint2f:
 45093                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45094                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45095                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45096                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45097                                  i2fpatch:

 45101                                  int2f_cont:

 45103

 45105                                  ;
