 45107                                  ;
 45108                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45109                                  
 45110                                  lcall_entry:
 45111                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45112                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45113                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45114                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45115                                  cpmpatch:
 45116 000010D0 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont	
 45117                                  
 45118 000010D2 E89A00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45119                                  callentry_cont:
 45120 000010D5 2EFF2E[7E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 45121                                  
 45122                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45123                                  
 45124                                  lirett:
 45125 000010DA CF                      	iret
 45126                                  
 45127                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45128                                  ;
 45129                                  ; LowIntXX:
 45130                                  ;
 45131                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 45132                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 45133                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 45134                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 45135                                  ;
 45136                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 45137                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 45138                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 45139                                  ;
 45140                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 45141                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 45142                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 45143                                  ;
 45144                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45145                                  
 45146 000010DB 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 45147 000010DF 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 45148 000010E3 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 45149                                  
 45150                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 45151                                  LowInt23:
 45152                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45153                                  					; the stack
 45154 000010E7 2E8F06[DB10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 45155 000010EC 2E8F06[DD10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 45156                                  
 45157 000010F1 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 45158                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45159                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45160                                  
 45161 000010F3 E87900                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 45162                                  
 45163 000010F6 2EFF2E[DB10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 45164                                  
 45165                                  
 45166                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 45167                                  LowInt24:
 45168                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45169                                  					; the stack
 45170 000010FB 2E8F06[DF10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 45171 00001100 2E8F06[E110]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 45172                                  
 45173 00001105 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 45174                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45175                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45176                                  
 45177 00001107 E86500                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45178                                  
 45179 0000110A 2EFF2E[DF10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 45180                                  
 45181                                  
 45182                                   
 45183                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 45184                                  LowInt28:
 45185 0000110F CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 45186                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45187                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45188                                  
 45189 00001111 E85B00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45190                                  
 45191 00001114 CB                      	retf
 45192                                  
 45193                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45194                                  
 45195                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45196                                  ;
 45197                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 45198                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 45199                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 45200                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 45201                                  ;
 45202                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45203                                  
 45204                                  disa20_xfer:
 45205 00001115 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 45206                                  
 45207                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 45208                                  
 45209                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 45210                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 45211                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 45212                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 45213                                  
 45214 00001118 FA                      	cli
 45215 00001119 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 45216                                  
 45217 0000111F 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 45218 00001121 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 45219 00001123 FB                      	sti
 45220                                  
 45221 00001124 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 45222 00001125 56                      	push	SI
 45223 00001126 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 45224 00001128 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 45225 0000112A 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 45226 0000112C CB                      	retf
 45227                                  
 45228                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45229                                  ;
 45230                                  ; M003:
 45231                                  ;
 45232                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 45233                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 45234                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 45235                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 45236                                  ; more info.	
 45237                                  ;
 45238                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 45239                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 45240                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 45241                                  ;
 45242                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45243                                  
 45244                                  disa20_iret:
 45245 0000112D E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 45246 00001130 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 45247 00001134 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 45248 00001138 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 45249 0000113C 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 45250                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 45251 0000113E 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 45252 00001141 A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 45253 00001144 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 45254 00001147 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 45255 0000114A A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 45256                                  
 45257 0000114D 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 45258 0000114E 5B                      	pop	BX
 45259 0000114F 59                      	pop	CX
 45260 00001150 5A                      	pop	DX
 45261 00001151 5E                      	pop	SI
 45262 00001152 5F                      	pop	DI
 45263 00001153 5D                      	pop	BP
 45264 00001154 1F                      	pop	DS
 45265 00001155 07                      	pop	ES
 45266 00001156 CF                      	iret
 45267                                  
 45268                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45269                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 45270                                  ;									      
 45271                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 45272                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45273                                  ;									      
 45274                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 45275                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 45276                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 45277                                  ;									      
 45278                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45279                                  
 45280                                  XMMDisableA20:
 45281 00001157 53                      	push	bx
 45282 00001158 50                      	push	ax
 45283                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 45284 00001159 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 45285 0000115B 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45286 00001160 58                      	pop	ax
 45287 00001161 5B                      	pop	bx
 45288 00001162 C3                      	retn
 45289                                  
 45290                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 45291                                  
 45292                                  XMMcontrol:
 45293 00001163 00000000                	dd	0
 45294                                  
 45295                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45296                                  ;
 45297                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 45298                                  ;									      
 45299                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 45300                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45301                                  ;									      
 45302                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 45303                                  ;
 45304                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 45305                                  ;		
 45306                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 45307                                  ;									      
 45308                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45309                                  
 45310                                  LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 45311 00001167 8000                    	dw	00080h
 45312 00001169 0000                    	dw	00000h
 45313                                  
 45314                                  HighMemory:	; label dword
 45315 0000116B 9000                    	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 45316 0000116D FFFF                    	dw	0FFFFh
 45317                                  
 45318                                  EnsureA20ON:
 45319 0000116F 9C                      	pushf
 45320 00001170 1E                      	push    ds
 45321 00001171 06                      	push	es
 45322 00001172 51                      	push	cx
 45323 00001173 56                      	push	si
 45324 00001174 57                      	push	di
 45325                                  
 45326 00001175 2EC536[6711]            	lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 45327 0000117A 2EC43E[6B11]            	les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 45328 0000117F B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 45329 00001182 FC                      	cld
 45330 00001183 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 45331                                  
 45332 00001185 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 45333                                  EA20_RET:
 45334 00001187 5F                      	pop	di
 45335 00001188 5E                      	pop	si
 45336 00001189 59                      	pop	cx
 45337 0000118A 07                      	pop	es
 45338 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds
 45339 0000118C 9D                      	popf
 45340 0000118D C3                      	retn
 45341                                  
 45342                                  EA20_OFF:
 45343                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 45344                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 45345                                  
 45346 0000118E 53                      	push	bx
 45347 0000118F 50                      	push	ax
 45348                                  
 45349 00001190 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 45350 00001192 2EA3[8610]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 45351 00001196 2E8926[8810]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 45352 0000119B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 45353 0000119D 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45354 0000119F BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 45355                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 45356                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 45357 000011A2 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 45358 000011A4 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45359 000011A9 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 45360 000011AB 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 45361                                  
 45362 000011AD 2EA1[8610]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 45363 000011B1 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45364 000011B3 2E8B26[8810]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 45365                                  
 45366 000011B8 58                      	pop	ax
 45367 000011B9 5B                      	pop	bx
 45368                                  
 45369 000011BA EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 45370                                  
 45371                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 45372 000011BC B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 45373 000011BE CD10                    	int	10h
 45374 000011C0 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 45375 000011C2 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 45376 000011C4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 45377 000011C6 B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 45378 000011C8 CD10                    	int	10h
 45379                                  XMMcont:
 45380 000011CA B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 45381 000011CC 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 45382 000011CE CD10                    	int	10h
 45383                                  	
 45384 000011D0 BE[B812]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 45385 000011D3 0E                      	push	cs
 45386 000011D4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45387 000011D5 FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 45388                                  XMMprnt:
 45389 000011D6 AC                      	lodsb
 45390 000011D7 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 45391 000011D9 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 45392 000011DB B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 45393 000011DD BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 45394 000011E0 CD10                    	int	10h

 45433                                  ;
 45434                                  ; DosHasHMA - This flag is set by seg_reinit when the DOS actually
 45435                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable
 45436                                  ;	indicator that the DOS is actually using HMA. You can't just use
 45437                                  ;	CS, because ROMDOS uses HMA with CS < F000.
 45438

 45480                                  ;
 45481                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 45482                                  ;
 45483                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 45484                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 45485                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 45486                                  ;
 45487                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 45488                                  ;
 45489                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 45490                                  ;
 45491                                  ;############################################################################
 45492                                   
 45493                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 45494                                  
 45495                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45496                                  
 45497                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 45498                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 45499                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 45500                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 45501                                  
 45502                                  ; country and code page information
 45503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45504                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 45505 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 45506 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 45506 0000123B 53595300           
 45507                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 45508 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 45509                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45510                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45511                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 45512                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 45513                                  ;  endif
 45514                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 45515                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 45516                                  ;  endif
 45517                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 45518                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 45519                                  ;  endif
 45520                                  ;else
 45521 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 45522                                  ;endif
 45523                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45524 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 45525 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 45526 00001277 [AD0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 45527 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45528 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 45529 0000127C [2F0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 45530 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45531 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 45532 00001281 [B10B]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 45533 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45534 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 45535 00001286 [E10B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 45536 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45537 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 45538 0000128B [E30C]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 45539 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 45540 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 45541 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 45542                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45543                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45544                                  ;	...... 
 45545                                  ;else
 45546 00001292 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 45547 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 45548 00001296 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 45549 00001298 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 45550 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 45551 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 45552 000012A1 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 45553 000012A3 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 45554 000012A5 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 45555 000012A6 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 45556 000012A7 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 45557 000012A8 [F50C]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 45558 000012AA 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 45559 000012AC 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator
 45560 000012AE 000000000000000000-     	dw   0,0,0,0,0			; reserved
 45560 000012B7 00

 45703                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 45704                                  ;
 45705                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 45706                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 45707                                  ;
 45708                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 45709                                  ;
 45710                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 45711                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 45712                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45713                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 45714                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 45715                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 45716                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 45717                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 45718                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 45719                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 45720                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 45721                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 45722                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 45723                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 45724                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 45725                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45726                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 45727                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45728                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 45729                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45730                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 45731                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 45732                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45733                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 45734                                  ;
 45735                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 45736                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 45737                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 45738                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 45739                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 45740                                  ;
 45741                                  ;   CRDROK:
 45742                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 45743                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45744                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 45745                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 45746                                  
 45747 00001314 061F                    DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 45748                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID

 45771                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 45772                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 45773                                  ;
 45774                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.

 45810                                  
 45811                                  ;============================================================================
 45812                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 45813                                  ;============================================================================
 45814                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 45815                                  
 45816                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 45817                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 45818                                  ;
 45819                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 45820                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 45821                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 45822                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 45823                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 45824                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 45825                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 45826                                  ; to call out here.
 45827                                  ;
 45828                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 45829                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 45830                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 45831                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 45832                                  ;       
 45833                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 45834                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 45835                                  ;
 45836                                  ;Exported Functions
 45837                                  ;==================
 45838                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 45839                                  
 45840                                  ; DosData Segment
 45841                                  
 45842                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45843                                  
 45844                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45845                                  
 45846                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 45847                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 45848                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 45849                                  ; 'patch' related.
 45850                                  
 45851                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 45852                                  	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 45853                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45854                                  
 45855                                  MagicPatch:
 45856                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 45857                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 45858                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 45859                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 45860                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 45861                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 45862                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 45863                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 45864                                  ;MagicPatch endp
